table_description: GitHub Repositories contain all of your project's files and each file's revision history.

columns.name: id
columns.description: The numeric ID of the repository.

columns.name: node_id
columns.description: The node ID of the repository.

columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the repository.

columns.name: allow_update_branch
columns.description: If true, a pull request head branch that is behind its base branch can always be updated even if it is not required to be up to date before merging.

columns.name: archived_at
columns.description: Timestamp when repository was archived.

columns.name: auto_merge_allowed
columns.description: If true, auto-merge can be enabled on pull requests in this repository.

columns.name: code_of_conduct
columns.description: The code of conduct for this repository.

columns.name: contact_links
columns.description: List of contact links associated to the repository.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the repository was created.

columns.name: default_branch_ref
columns.description: Default ref information.

columns.name: delete_branch_on_merge
columns.description: If true, branches are automatically deleted when merged in this repository.

columns.name: description
columns.description: The description of the repository.

columns.name: disk_usage
columns.description: Number of kilobytes this repository occupies on disk.

columns.name: fork_count
columns.description: Number of forks there are of this repository in the whole network.

columns.name: forking_allowed
columns.description: If true, repository allows forks.

columns.name: funding_links
columns.description: The funding links for this repository.

columns.name: has_discussions_enabled
columns.description: If true, the repository has the Discussions feature enabled.

columns.name: has_issues_enabled
columns.description: If true, the repository has issues feature enabled.

columns.name: has_projects_enabled
columns.description: If true, the repository has the Projects feature enabled.

columns.name: has_vulnerability_alerts_enabled
columns.description: If true, vulnerability alerts are enabled for the repository.

columns.name: has_wiki_enabled
columns.description: If true, the repository has wiki feature enabled.

columns.name: homepage_url
columns.description: The external URL of the repository if set.

columns.name: interaction_ability
columns.description: The interaction ability settings for this repository.

columns.name: is_archived
columns.description: If true, the repository is unmaintained (archived).

columns.name: is_blank_issues_enabled
columns.description: If true, blank issue creation is allowed.

columns.name: is_disabled
columns.description: If true, this repository disabled.

columns.name: is_empty
columns.description: If true, this repository is empty.

columns.name: is_fork
columns.description: If true, the repository is a fork.

columns.name: is_in_organization
columns.description: If true, repository is either owned by an organization, or is a private fork of an organization repository.

columns.name: is_locked
columns.description: If true, repository is locked.

columns.name: is_mirror
columns.description: If true, the repository is a mirror.

columns.name: is_private
columns.description: If true, the repository is private or internal.

columns.name: is_security_policy_enabled
columns.description: If true, repository has a security policy.

columns.name: is_template
columns.description: If true, the repository is a template that can be used to generate new repositories.

columns.name: is_user_configuration_repository
columns.description: If true, this is a user configuration repository.

columns.name: issue_templates
columns.description: A list of issue templates associated to the repository.

columns.name: license_info
columns.description: The license associated with the repository.

columns.name: lock_reason
columns.description: The reason the repository has been locked.

columns.name: merge_commit_allowed
columns.description: If true, PRs are merged with a merge commit on this repository.

columns.name: merge_commit_message
columns.description: How the default commit message will be generated when merging a pull request.

columns.name: merge_commit_title
columns.description: How the default commit title will be generated when merging a pull request.

columns.name: mirror_url
columns.description: The repository's original mirror URL.

columns.name: name_with_owner
columns.description: The repository's name with owner.

columns.name: open_graph_image_url
columns.description: The image used to represent this repository in Open Graph data.

columns.name: owner_login
columns.description: Login of the repository owner.

columns.name: primary_language
columns.description: The primary language of the repository's code.

columns.name: projects_url
columns.description: The URL listing the repository's projects.

columns.name: pull_request_templates
columns.description: Returns a list of pull request templates associated to the repository.

columns.name: pushed_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the repository was last pushed to.

columns.name: rebase_merge_allowed
columns.description: If true, rebase-merging is enabled on this repository.

columns.name: security_policy_url
columns.description: The security policy URL.

columns.name: squash_merge_allowed
columns.description: If true, squash-merging is enabled on this repository.

columns.name: squash_merge_commit_message
columns.description: How the default commit message will be generated when squash merging a pull request.

columns.name: squash_merge_commit_title
columns.description: How the default commit title will be generated when squash merging a pull request.

columns.name: ssh_url
columns.description: The SSH URL to clone this repository.

columns.name: stargazer_count
columns.description: Returns a count of how many stargazers there are on this repository.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: Timestamp when repository was last updated.

columns.name: url
columns.description: The URL of the repository.

columns.name: possible_commit_emails
columns.description: A list of emails you can commit to this repository with.

columns.name: visibility
columns.description: Indicates the repository's visibility level.

columns.name: web_commit_signoff_required
columns.description: If true, contributors are required to sign off on web-based commits in this repository.

columns.name: repository_topics_total_count
columns.description: Count of topics associated with the repository.

columns.name: open_issues_total_count
columns.description: Count of issues open on the repository.

columns.name: watchers_total_count
columns.description: Count of watchers on the repository.

columns.name: hooks
columns.description: The API Hooks URL.

columns.name: topics
columns.description: The topics (similar to tags or labels) associated with the repository.

columns.name: subscribers_count
columns.description: The number of users who have subscribed to the repository.

columns.name: has_downloads
columns.description: If true, the GitHub Downloads feature is enabled on the repository.

columns.name: has_pages
columns.description: If true, the GitHub Pages feature is enabled on the repository.

columns.name: network_count
columns.description: The number of member repositories in the network.
